definition[0]: to tie something tightly to something else with a rope
example[0]: The oars were lashed to the sides of the boat.
definition[1]: if the wind, sea etc lashes something, it hits it with violent force
example[1]: Giant waves lashed the sea wall.
example[2]: The wind lashed violently against the door.
definition[2]: to hit a person or animal very hard with a whip, stick etc
example[3]: Oliver lashed the horses to go faster.
definition[3]: if an animal lashes its tail, or if its tail lashes, it moves it from side to side quickly and strongly, especially because it is angry
definition[4]: to criticize someone angrily â€“ used especially in newspapers
example[4]: Democrats lashed Republican plans, calling them extreme.
example[5]: Gallins lashed back at those who accused him of corruption.
definition[5]: a hit with a whip, especially as a punishment
example[6]: They were each given fifty lashes.
definition[6]: one of the hairs that grow around the edges of your eyes
definition[7]: a sudden or violent movement like that of a whip
example[7]: With a lash of its tail, the lion sprang at its prey.
definition[8]: the thin piece of leather at the end of a whip
